column1: length outside off, but way too wide
length again, this time on the pads, misses the flick but will collect a leg-bye to short fine leg
down the track but it's short of length angled across, sways away in the end
down the wicket again, fuller outside off this time, McCullum tries to jam his bat at it, no connection
an inswinging yorker, on the stumps, McCullum gets his bat down just in time, a single to short fine leg
length around off, an ugly-looking swipe towards mid-on
fuller and wider, McCullum chases it but no connection there
starts with a fuller one outside off, Bryant reaches for it, and hits it towards long-off
length around off, nudges it towards short midwicket for a quick single
fuller on the pads, flicked away but the square leg makes a diving stop to his left
length around off, spinning away, looks to go big down the ground, misses
flatter and quicker around off, hits it towards long-off
length around off, a touch slower this time, pushes it down the wicket
fuller around off, driven on the front foot but mid-off moves to his left to cut it off
length, just outside off, looks to cut but there is not enough room, gets beaten
length around off, hits it on the up, neat connection this time but straight to the cover fielder
length from around the wicket, stays back and deflects it past the short third man

Jofra Archer! You beauty! What a catch. It was fuller around off and Bryant smashes it over long-on but Archer takes it casually with his outstretched right hand, lobs it back as the momentum takes him over the boundary line, comes back and grabs it to complete the catch
fuller on the stumps, looks to drive but the ball hits the inner half and rolls towards short fine leg
fuller around off, driven towards wide long-off to get off the mark
length outside off, was looking to sweep but changes his mind in the end and lets it go
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards the left of square leg for one
use of feet but Rose shortens his length, defended in the end
down the track once again and lofted over mid-on, not the best of the timings but enough for it to trickle over the wide long-on boundary
fuller on the stumps, defended from the crease
short of length, hurries on to the batsman as he looks to pull, drags it towards square leg
length, angling in to the batsman who was looking to hoick it on the leg side, misses
short of length outside off, goes for the cut. A thick outside edge flies over the short third man
an attempted bouncer, at the batsman but flies over him and the keeper for five wides
pitched up around middle, Lynn clears his front leg and looks to clear mid-off but doesn't get the elevation. Bailey takes it around chest height at mid-off
146.2 kph, and Renshaw departs first ball, was a length ball, angling across the left-hander who pokes at it and gets an outside edge to the keeper. He would be on a hat-trick when he comes on next
fuller around off, pushes it towards extra cover

down the track and looks to go aerial down the track, doesn't middle it and ends up slicing it over the bowler's head. Bailey from mid-off backpedals and looks to take it over his right shoulder, fumbles but clings on the second time
fuller and wider, throws his bat at it and gets it over cover-point for four
pushes it towards mid-on, and sets off, a chance of run-out but the fielder fumbles
length outside off, looks to hit it on the up, misses
length around off, pushes it towards mid-off for a quick single
fuller around off, drops it towards covers for a quick single
length around off, dabs it towards cover-point for one
length outside off, pushed towards sweeper cover for a couple
short of length around off, guides it towards backward point
short of length, swivels to pull it towards deep backward square leg
back of length outside off, dabs it towards third man
fuller on the stumps, sweeps it towards deep square leg
short of length outside off, cuts it towards point
fuller outside off, driven back, a diving stop by the bowler towards his right
length on middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on for one
short of length, room outside off, goes back and cuts it to the sweeper cover boundary
fuller around off, driven firmly but a sliding stop by the mid-on to his left keeps it to one
short of length outside off, dabbed towards third man for one more
in the blockhole, jams his bat at it to dig it out towards cover
length around off, tapped from the front foot towards extra cover
length again, around middle, was looking to work it on the leg side, closes the face a bit early, leading edge down the wicket
fuller around off, driven firmly but straight to extra cover
worked towards deep square leg for one
fuller and wider, comes down the track and hits it towards wide long-off
length, angled outside off, goes for the sweep but misses
length again, connects the sweep this time, a single to midwicket
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, sweeps it towards deep square leg
fuller around off, driven through covers, not the best of the timing but will get two as the mid-off chases it
back of length outside off, dabs it towards short third man, straight to the fielder
back of length outside off, some room there and Ross cuts it hard past the backward point fielder
back of length on the stumps, dabs it towards short fine leg
fuller around off, hits it right back towards the bowler who bends in his followthrough to make the stop
short of length outside off, goes for the pull but makes no connection
fuller around off, driven towards long-off
short of length outside off, goes back and punches it towards deep extra cover, scampers back for the second
length ball on the stumps, punches it towards long-on
backs away quite early, Rose sees it and slips one in fuller and wider, the batsman cannot do anything about it
fuller on the stumps, pushed down the ground for one
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards deep backward point
short of length on the stumps, pulled towards deep midwicket
length outside off, steers it towards short third man
short outside off, goes for the cut but misses
flatter, dropped short, goes back and pulls it over deep midwicket for a maximum
short again, pulls it towards deep midwicket for one
fuller on the stumps, goes for the sweep, gets a top-edge towards deep square leg, Archer leaps in the air but cannot get a hand to it, second six of the over
fuller on the stumps, smashes but straight back towards the bowler
length on middle and leg, flicked towards short fine leg
length ball on the stumps, angled in with the arm, backs away and punches it towards mid-off
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket
short of length outside off, some room there, cuts it towards extra cover
almost chipped back, length around off, pushes it at but it falls just short of the bowler
length outside off, looks for the cut but ends up chopping it into the ground
short of length outside off, cuts it towards backward point, one bounce to the fielder who jumps to make a stop overhead
length outside off, cuts it through extra cover, beats the man in the deep
slower one outside off, throws his bat at it but misses
length ball, on the stumps, moves across and smashes it over mid-off
fuller outside off, jams his bat at it but makes no connection
reverse sweep and makes a fair connection, beats the man at sweeper cover on his left
short of length and goes back this time to pull it between deep square leg and deep midwicket
straying on the pads and pulled fine, past the short fine leg fielder for the third boundary in as many balls
unlucky! Fuller on the stumps, looks to hit straight but gets an inside edge past short fine leg, gets a couple
length on middle and leg, flicked towards deep square leg, gets to his fifty, off just 29 balls
length on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
fuller around off, moves across and lofts it over long-on, into the crowd for a six
fuller outside off, smashes it towards deep backward point this time
length but way outside off, cuts it towards deep backward point for a couple
fuller around off, drives it towards long-off, only a single this time
short of length, moves across towards the off side and pulls it past the square leg fielder for four, 14 from the over so far
fuller and wider and Peirson reaches out for it, flies off the bat but one bounce to the fielder
fuller outside off, steers it towards third man
a full toss on the stumps and smashed straight back past the bowler, 100 off the stand comes up. 102 off 72
short of length, but fractionally down the leg side, called a wide as the batsman stays inside the line
a high full toss, hits it towards long-on
slower one, fuller outside off, steers it towards deep cover
fuller, just outside off, jams his bat at it, gets an outside edge that races past the third man fielder
fuller, in the corridor, looks to hit out, gets an outside edge to the keeper
yorker length, just outside off, Peirson fails to get bat on it
similar delivery, bu the batsman moves outside the line and flicks it towards square leg
back of length outside off, tapped towards backward point for one
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards third man
back of length outside off, goes for the pull but ends up slicing it over extra cover
short of length in the line of the stumps, goes for the pull but misses
fuller on middle and leg, goes for the slog, mistimes it towards deep square leg
length on the stumps, goes back and pulls it towards midwicket
fuller outside off, smashes it towards wide long-off but will get only a single
fuller on the stumps, backs away and hits it towards long-off
short of length, goes for the pull, mistimes it towards midwicket
full and straight, backs away and looks to hit it through extra cover, misses and the stumps are rattled
length around off, punched towards extra cover to get off the mark
length on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
angled on the stumps, pushed towards short midwicket
fuller outside off, digs it out towards covers
length around off, punched towards mid-off from the front foot
length around off, dabs it towards short third man
short of length on the stumps, tucked away towards midwicket
a touch fuller around off, drives it towards wide mid-off
fuller around off and smoked over backward square leg, on the roof it seems. The fourth umpire is out with a box of the balls
length but down the leg side, Wade looks to flick it away, misses
fuller, almost a yorker on the stumps, flicked away towards fine leg for a couple
short of length, on middle and leg, goes for the pull but doesn't middle it and short fine leg takes a comfortable catch
length around off, punched towards extra cover
length but on the pads, swiped away towards backward square leg for four
fuller around off stump, hits it towards long-off for one
backs away but it's a full toss on middle and leg, can only push it towards short midwicket
length outside off, backs away once again, pushes at it but gets beaten
length around off, chips it towards mid-off, but well short of the fielder who dives towards his left
but starts with a leg-side wide, fuller but the wrong direction
short of length outside off, backs away and hits it towards covers
short of length outside off, pulls it in the air, doesn't get the power behind it as it falls well short of the incoming deep midwicket fielder
short of length outside off, punches it through cover-point for four
length ball but on the pads, tucked away towards deep backward square leg, a sliding stop there prevents the boundary
fuller outside off, smashes it towards covers
short of length outside off, punched towards point off the back foot
length around middle, pushed towards short midwicket
length again, carrom ball it looked like, defended towards short midwicket
length around off, a thick outside edge as Jewell was looking to play on the leg side
length outside off, cuts it towards cover-point
length around off, chipped uppishly towards mid-off, beats the fielder and gets a couple
short of length outside off, goes back and mistimes the cut towards cover
length but on the pads, flicked away fine, races away towards the fine leg boundary
length around off, punched towards mid-off
a touch fuller around off, cuts it towards deep point
back of length on the stumps, moves across and flicks it over the short fine leg, one bounce and over the boundary
moves towards leg side this time, and pulls this short of length delivery to the square leg boundary, successive fours
length around off, moves towards the off side and looks to drive, gets beaten on the inside edge
a low full toss on the stumps and smashes down the ground, bisecting the long-off and long-on
short of length, flatter this time, pulled towards deep midwicket
backs away and drives this length ball towards sweeper cover
length on middle, defended back towards the bowler
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket for a couple
length outside off, punched towards mid-off
slower length ball, wide outside off, looks to cut it hard but misses
a low full toss outside off, hits it towards deep extra cover for a couple
slower one, full but way too outside
length ball, angling across, mistimes the cut towards long-off
almost a wide yorker, steers it towards deep cover
fuller around off ans smashed over the head of the non-striker for four
slower one, some room outside off, cuts it hard but straight to deep cover
length on middle and leg and swept hard behind square, four more to the total
fuller outside off and crunched through covers, Doggett makes a diving one-handed stop to his left
pushed towards midwicket, a bit of fumble there allows two
length around off, punched towards long-off
swept and swept hard towards deep midwicket, the long-on fielder has no chance to cut it off
another sweep and another four, length outside off and this time Short goes behind square leg
a low full toss on the stumps, hits it towards long-on
slower one, makes some room and smashes it towards mid-off, a diving stop to his right keeps it to one
fuller and wider, steers it towards deep cover-point
short of length but down the leg side, goes for the pull and just beats the man at short fine leg
short, this time outside off, forehands it towards deep midwicket
slower length ball outside off, moves towards the off side but drives it back towards the bowler
short of length, goes back and pulls it towards deep midwicket
a high full toss outside off, slapped towards deep square leg
fuller around off, drives it hard but straight towards long-off
bowled outside off from wide of the crease, looks to go over the top but makes no connection
length outside off, swept hard towards deep square leg for a couple
fuller outside off, hits it in the air but in the gap as well, four to deep extra cover
short of length outside off, cuts it towards deep backward point, the sweeper cover sprints to his right, puts in the dive to stop it just inside
short of length outside off, and this time cuts it towards the left of the sweeper cover, two more
length around off, goes back and pulls it towards deep midwicket, brings up his fifty
short of length and pulled towards deep midwicket for another single
length ball but Short goes deep and creates the length. Pulls it over deep square leg for a six
length ball on middle and leg and this time he goes down on one knee, pulls it between deep square leg and fine leg for four
backs away, the bowler follows him but ends up bowling it fuller and Jewell picks it away towards the right of deep square leg, one bounce and over the boundary line
backs away again and this time Doggett bowls a bouncer, Jewell goes for the pull, ends up top-edging it but it flies over Cutting at deep square leg
moves away again and this time uses his wrists to flick it past the diving deep square leg for four more
brilliant yorker this time, following the batsman, who fails to get bat on it, hits the back leg as he tumbles
once again in the blockhole, jams his bat and it goes past the keeper, Mujeeb makes a sliding stop at fine leg, not a very elegant stop but efficient
moves towards the off side and flicks it to the right of Mujeeb at fine leg for two more
slower one outside off, hits it over cover but the fielder in the deep keeps it to two
slower one outside off, looks to go over extra cover, ends up slicing it towards deep point
another slower one, length outside off, cuts it towards deep point
full but way outside off, eight needed now
slower again, length but way too outside off
a low full toss outside off, hits it towards extra cover, a tumbling stop there
short of length outside off, mistimes the cut towards covers
length outside off, punched towards deep point for one
length on the stumps, sweeps it towards square leg

fuller on the stumps and smashes it towards deep extra cover, a diving stop there keeps it to two. The third umpire wants to be fully sure, he is watching it from every possible angle and he think that's a four
